review_comments_data.body: Presumably this is during some time period. This is as I understand it without consideration of whether or not the issues were opened or closed in the time period.

review_comments_data.body:
Discussion on 6/14/2018 or 14/6/2018: 
- Should the metric be expressed in context with the value of its parameters. For example: "[Sixty Day Window From Issue Open Date] Issue Resolution Efficiency" ... or something simpler ... is there some kind of shorthand we can come up with for parameter expression?

review_comments_data.body: Does it make sense to have this be the beginning or the end? I think either one would generate the same number because you are going to simply be adding "open now, but not opened during this period" in effect. I am tryin to think of when the number would be different at the beginning or end if its a windowed time period?
review_comments_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,25 +1,62 @@
 # Issue Resolution Efficiency
 
 ## 1. Description
-What is the number of closed issues/number of abandoned issues?
+What is the number of closed issues/number of open issues?
 
 ## 2. Use Cases
-Provide examples of how the metric might inform different stakeholders through use cases.
+* A project interested in knowing if they are coping well or not
+with the issues being open, and how that evolves over time.
+This metric informs them exactly about that.
+If there are more issues being opened that issues being closed
+during a long period of time, the number of unresolved issues is going to grow.
 
 ## 3. Formula
-A generic formula (in pseudo code) to generate the metric.
+The definition is for a time period (for example, for a certain month):
+
+**Definitions:**
+
+* `issues_closed`: Total number of issues closed during the period
+* `issues_opened`: Total number of issues opened during the period
+* `issues_backlog`: Total number of issues open at the beginning of the period (backlog of open issues)

data.body:
After the discussion in #5, this tries to apply the results and consensus of that discussion, to start defining this metric.

Closes: #5.
data.title: Add detailed definition of Issue Resolution Efficiency
